usefulItems: wire rack, silicone bread mat, plastic wrap, 2 baking trays (40 x 35 cm), baking paper, pastry brush, sealable container, refrigerator, oven
title: Pfeffernüsse (German spice biscuits)

preparations.content: Place molasses, honey and butter into mixing bowl and heat <b>7 min/80°C/speed 2<b>. Transfer into a bowl and allow to cool. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place all remaining pfeffernüsse ingredients, except eggs, into mixing bowl and mix <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.

Add eggs and reserved honey and molasses mixture and mix <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Wrap dough in plastic wrap or a silicone bread mat, then place in refrigerator for a minimum 2 hours or overnight. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 160°C. Line 2 baking trays (40 x 35 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Take 2 teaspoons of the dough at a time and roll into balls (approx. 47). Arrange balls on prepared baking trays 4 cm apart and press down on each ball to flatten slightly.
Bake for 10-12 minutes (160°C), then transfer onto a wire rack and allow to cool.
Place sugar in mixing bowl and mill <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add rum (optional) and water and mix <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>.

Place pfeffernüsse onto a sheet of baking paper then, using a pastry brush, spread glaze onto the top of each biscuit. Serve immediately or transfer into a sealable storage container to store until use.

hintsAndTricks: If your icing is too thick add 1 tsp water and mix <b>3 sec/speed 3<b>.

Pfeffernüsse or Peppernuts are a traditional spice biscuit enjoyed in Germany, Denmark and The Netherlands. These delicious little biscuits have been closely related to Christmas since the 1850's and make a delightful gift when packaged up for friends and family.
